subject: Economics
title: What Is Game Theory? The Science of Strategy
description: A quick, practical guide to What Is Game Theory? The Science of Strategy.

hook.text: Every time you negotiate a salary, bid in an auction, or choose a lane in traffic, you're playing a game.

buildup.text: Game theory studies how rational players make decisions when their outcomes depend on what others do.

discovery.text: John von Neumann and Oskar Morgenstern founded the field in 1944. Their insight: economics isn't solitaire.

twist.text: Game theory assumes people are rational. But Nobel laureates keep proving they aren't.

climax.text: Game theory gives us a framework to analyze conflict, cooperation, and competition.

punchline.text: Life is a game. Game theory is the strategy guide nobody gave you.

quiz.question: What makes a situation a 'game' in game theory?
options: Your outcome depends on what other rational players decide to do
